availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Fenton Sims (Trigg County, Kentucky, student and lawyer)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, student and lawyer. Christian County, Kentucky, native. Son of Garland Sims and Sarah Sims. Student in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attended the University of Louisville in Jefferson County, Kentucky. Lawyer in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 295A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 193.
"The Late Fenton Sims," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), December 3, 1904, p. 4.
"William Fenton Sims (1837-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #124380324, accessed January 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124380324.
